result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Mechelke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Michael R Mechelke

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted.
Credit for 20 days served on Count 1 if Probation is revoked.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Court orders DNA surcharge.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain full-time employment.
If unemployed or underemployed, must seek work at 5 places per week and submit report to the Child Support Agency and Probation Agent.

Must pay child support and arrears in full and on time through WI SCTF.
Tax refund to be intercepted for child support arrears.
$250.00 cash bond to be forwarded to the Child Support Agency for arrears.
Must notify the Child Support Agency and Probation Agent of change of address and/or employer within 48 hours.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

Defendant Michael R Mechelke in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  
State relates joint agreement.  Victim's rights have been complied with.
State moves to amend Counts 1 and 2 to misdemeanor 948.22(3) - fail to pay child support.  Court grants amendment on both counts.
Court questions defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea on both counts as amended.  Court accepts and finds guilty on both counts.
State relates.  Attorney O'Hara relates.  
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders:  Imposed and Stayed
Jail with huber: 6 months each count - to be served consecutively - Stayed.  Credit for 20 days served on Count 1 if revoked.
Probation: 2 years.
Must pay child support and arrears in full and on time.
Must maintain fulltime employment.
Must seek work at 5 places per week if unemployed or underemployed and submit report to Child Support Agency and Probation Agent. 
Must notify Child Support Agency and Probation Agent of change of address or employer within 48 hours.
DNA surcharge.
Tax refund to be intercepted for Child Support arrears.
$250.00 cash bond be forwarded to Child Support Agency for arrears of restitution.
